column4: does anyone know how could have the printer printing dublex pages?
hello guys, i have a serious problem, could you help me?
ok, i enabled the root passwd
after this i disabled it and now i can't run any command as user with sudo
congratulations for doing the number 1 thing that's always been adviced against in Ubuntu ;-)
are you in the "admin" group?
cat /etc/group | grep yourusername (sorry, rough way... i don't remember the "politically correct" command :)
then your /etc/sudoers is probably messed up. have you edited it?
have you run "visudo" by any chance?
no i haven't

ok, you need to edit /etc/sudoers and fix it. however, you need to be root to do that... so i guess you'll either have to boot your system to rescue mode (you can do that from the boot menu), or use a live cd
a correct /etc/sudoers file looks like      root ALL=(ALL) ALL    and then on the following line   %admin ALL=(ALL) ALL
by default ubuntu also has a line at the beginning that says     Default    !lecture,tty-tickets,!fqdn
but yeah that should be all (i'm not even sure that last line i mentioned is really needed)
hold on a second
i can never remember whether you *can* boot to rescue mode, without a working admin password
(otherwise, the only option is the live cd)
ok, see what gnomefreak said
what's working?
what i am supposed to do? can i boot?
yes, you can boot and then you can edit /etc/sudoers by typing "visudo" (or failing that, "nano /etc/sudoers")
ok, i will be back in a while, thanks
